alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 8:02PM CST until February 26 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Pickens and Sumter Counties. .Rainfall on Monday as well as forecast rain during the next couple of days over the Tombigbee River basin is expected to result in water rises and flooding along the river. A flood warning is now in effect for the Tombigbee River. Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. At 128.0 feet, Cattle in the area should be moved to higher ground. Flooding of some cabins and camps along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 113.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday morning to a crest of 124.2 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
